greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the least number k > 0 such that sigma(k) = phi(n*k).
comment: Is a(n) = A087979(n) for n>=5? - _Manfred Scheucher_, May 28 2015
maple: for n from 1 to q do for k from 1 to q do
if sigma(k)=phi(k*n) then lprint(n,k); break; fi;
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[DivisorSigma[1, k] != EulerPhi[n k], k++]; k, {n, 20}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 28 2015 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {k=1; while(sigma(k) != eulerphi(n*k), k++); k;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 01 2015
results.author: _Paolo P. Lava_, Apr 01 2015
